meanings.definition: A device consisting of a spinning wheel or rotor mounted on a base that exhibits properties of angular momentum.
meanings.sent1: The gyroscope on the toy airplane helped it stay balanced during flight.
meanings.sent2: The technician used a gyroscope to measure the rotation speed of the engine.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat mistook the gyroscope for a toy and tried to play with it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gyroscope, spinning with ideas and possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The gyroscope hummed softly as it spun, a mesmerizing sight to behold.

meanings.definition: An instrument used for maintaining orientation or measuring angular velocity.
meanings.sent1: The gyroscope in the spaceship ensured it stayed on course through the galaxy.
meanings.sent2: Pilots rely on a gyroscope to keep their planes steady in turbulent weather.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey accidentally activated the gyroscope and sent the room spinning.
meanings.sent4: His intuition acted like a gyroscope, always guiding him in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The gyroscope whirred as it detected the slightest change in direction, a true marvel of technology.
